intro: Halophila × tanabensis, commonly known as the Tanabense seagrass, is a hybrid species within the genus Halophila, which belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. This plant thrives in shallow, brackish coastal waters, often found in estuaries and tidal zones where salinity levels fluctuate. Halophila × tanabensis plays a vital role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for marine organisms. Its presence is an indicator of healthy coastal ecosystems.
